newsitem.title: USA: US aluminum premium pressured as LME contango ebbs.
newsitem.headline: US aluminum premium pressured as LME contango ebbs.

text.p: Aluminum premiums in the United States came under pressure this week as the LME aluminum cash discount to three months or contango contracted further, making it difficult to finance inventory and dampening business, dealers said.
"You just cannot finance stocks as a new play," a dealer said.
The LME cash to three months contango has shrunk to $14/$16, down from $23/$24 two weeks ago. It has been contracting consistently for the past few weeks.
The normal contango for financing is about $30/$31.
The immediate, spot delivery premiums remain firm at about 5.50-6.00 cents per pound over LME cash, but once delivery dates move to June, the premium falls to below 5 cents.
"With LME spreads coming in, nobody wants to talk about business at all, and it's putting pressure on premiums," a merchant said.
Premiums on deliveries in the second half of the year have edged back some 0.25 cent to about 4.25 cents per pound over LME cash.
